ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Chorus of Clarity Stacking
ygData.msgSnippet: Definately.  The mana song, unlike others does not have an icon.  Each time it pulses it gives your casters a burst of mana.  Multiple bards mean multiple
ygData.messageBody:
Definately. The mana song, unlike others does not have an icon. Each time
it pulses it gives your casters a 'burst' of mana. Multiple bards mean
multiple bursts, there is nothing to conflict with.
Whenever we have to do a large CR (lots of rezzing) we group 2-3 bards with
the Clerics to speed up their mana recovery. It makes a huge difference.


Elwyn <Da`Kor>
52 Minstrel of Erollisi Marr

-----Original Message-----
From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 11, 2000 12:27 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Chorus of Clarity Stacking


Hi all,

I just wanted to confirm something that I'm sure I've read, but haven't
been able to confirm from Bard Song Analysis site. This came across last
night as I was grouped with another bard, which hasn't happened to me in a
long time.

If there are 2 bards in the group and both are singing Chorus of Clarity,
is mana recovered faster than if just 1 were singing it? I checked with
some bards logged on-line last night and received a "no", "maybe" and a
"yes, most definitely".

Of course, the "no" answer came from a bard who didn't realize that Anthem
de Arms was an Atk speed buff, and thought that Whistling Warsong buffed
the entire party. : ) Man, he needs to read Rokken's website.

Windleaf Mistsong
Clan Battlehammer
Bertox
